com.blockwithme.util.shared.domains

Interface Domain<E>

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    BooleanDomain, ByteDomain, CharacterDomain, EnumDomain, FloatDomain, GenericLazyDomain, IntegerDomain, ShortDomain

    public interface Domain<E>
    Represents a finite, but normally lazy, set of values, each with an integer ID.
    Author:
    monster

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean exactType()
      Returns true, if "value.getClass() == type" is required, otherwise "value instanceof type" is required.
      int getID(E value)
      Returns the ID for a value.
      Class<E> getType()
      Returns the type of the Domain.
      E getValue(int id)
      Returns the value for this ID.
      boolean supportsNull()
      Returns true, if null values are supported.

    • Method Detail

      • getType

        Class<E> getType()
        Returns the type of the Domain.

      • supportsNull

        boolean supportsNull()
        Returns true, if null values are supported.

      • exactType

        boolean exactType()
        Returns true, if "value.getClass() == type" is required, otherwise "value instanceof type" is required.

      • getID

        int getID(E value)
        Returns the ID for a value.
        Throws:
        RuntimeException - if supportNull() is false.

      • getValue

        E getValue(int id)
        Returns the value for this ID.
        Throws:
        RuntimeException - if id is invalid.
